ZOLMITRIPTAN

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Cautions
  • Unlicensed use
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Treatment of acute migraine,

By intranasal administration

  • For adults
    2.5 mg, followed by 2.5 mg after at least 2 hours if required, dose to be taken only if migraine recurs, then increased if necessary to 5 mg, dose to be taken only for subsequent attacks in patients not achieving satisfactory relief with 2.5 mg dose; maximum 10 mg per day.
  • For adults
    5 mg, dose to be administered as soon as possible after onset into one nostril only, followed by 5 mg after at least 2 hours if required, dose to be administered only if migraine recurs; maximum 10 mg per day.

Treatment of acute cluster headache,

By intranasal administration

  • For adults
    5 mg, dose to be administered as soon as possible after onset into one nostril only, followed by 5 mg after at least 2 hours if required, dose to be administered only if migraine recurs; maximum 10 mg per day.

Dose adjustments due to interactions

Max. 5 mg in 24 hours with concomitant cimetidine, fluvoxamine, moclobemide, or quinolone antibiotics.

Dose equivalence and conversion

1 spray of Zomig nasal spray = 5 mg zolmitriptan.

Advice when patient is pregnant

There is limited experience of using 5HT1-receptor agonists during pregnancy; manufacturers advise that they should be avoided unless the potential benefit outweighs the risk.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Max. 5 mg in 24 hours in moderate or severe impairment.

Contra indications

  • Arrhythmias associated with accessory cardiac conduction pathways
  • coronary vasospasm
  • ischaemic heart disease
  • previous cerebrovascular accident
  • previous myocardial infarction
  • Prinzmetal's angina
  • severe hypertension
  • transient ischaemic attack
  • uncontrolled hypertension
  • Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Abdominal pain, drowsiness, dry mouth, dysphagia, headache, muscle weakness, myalgia, palpitation, paraesthesia,

uncommon: Polyuria, tachycardia, transient increase in blood pressure,

rare: Urticaria,

veryRare: Angina, gastro-intestinal infarction, ischaemic colitis, myocardial infarction, splenic infarction,

notKnown: Dizziness, fatigue, feeling of weakness, flushing,

Specific side effects

notKnown: epistaxis, taste disturbance,

Sensations of tingling, heat, heaviness, pressure, or tightness of any part of the body may occur (including throat and chest—discontinue if intense, may be due to coronary vasoconstriction or to anaphylaxis).

Directions for administration

Zolmitriptan orodispersible tablets should be placed on the tongue, allowed to disperse and swallowed.

Advice for patients and carers

Patients or carers should be given advice on how to administer zolmitriptan orodispersible tablets.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Conditions which predispose to coronary artery disease
  • elderly
  • should not be taken within 24 hours of any other 5HT1-receptor agonist

Unlicensed use

Not licensed for use in elderly.

Not licensed for treatment of cluster headaches.

Prepared medicinal forms of ZOLMITRIPTAN

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Tablet
Orodispersible tablet
Spray
